"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "50a1188d8b4fb5d38b052f7aba95557d",
"text": "1. Adequate veterinary care must be provided and it is the responsibility of a veterinarian or a fish health care professional, or a person who has adequate training or experience in handling fish/ aquaculture.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "a50eb7ba2679ca5de6babd8974a99327",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "5642398ecabcdec883ffd3777c2cd585",
"text": "Regular observation of fish can be accomplished by someone other than a veterinarian or a fish health care professional or a person who has adequate training or experience in handling fish/ aquaculture; however, a mechanism of direct and frequent communication should be adopted so that timely and accurate information on problems in fish health and well being is conveyed to the concerned professional.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "a50eb7ba2679ca5de6babd8974a99327",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "eabfb0e435d45797825b482f307b50f2",
"text": "2.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "a50eb7ba2679ca5de6babd8974a99327",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "ab8f1403c16ad99dd58019c1b7075535",
"text": "3.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "a50eb7ba2679ca5de6babd8974a99327",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "c93830e87f3cf586f51ab6f318112868",
"text": "The veterinarian or a fish health care professional or a person who has adequate training or experience in handling fish/ aquaculture can also help the establishment in designing appropriate policies and procedures for ancillary aspects of health care, such as the use of appropriate methods to prevent and control diseases (e.g. vaccination and other prophylaxis, disease monitoring and surveillance, quarantine and isolation), operative and post-operative care, diagnosis and treatment of diseases as well as injuries. Reviewing protocols and proposals, fisheries and welfare, monitoring occupational health hazards containment and zoonosis control programs; and supervising nutrition and sanitation.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "a50eb7ba2679ca5de6babd8974a99327",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "b33b77d4ff42acae3d82c3d517fdf038",
"text": "9. MONITORING, DIAGNOSIS AND CONTROL OF DISEASE",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ecea5d695753c82c7e3a8e55fcb4c69a",
"text": "1. All fish should be observed for signs of illness, injury, or abnormal behaviour by designated staff. As a rule, this should occur daily, but more-frequent observations might be warranted, during experimentation or when fish are ill or have a physical deficit. It is imperative that, appropriate methods be in place for disease monitoring and diagnosis.

MONITORING, DIAGNOSIS AND CONTROL OF DISEASE",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ecea5d695753c82c7e3a8e55fcb4c69a",
"text": "1. All fish should be observed for signs of illness, injury, or abnormal behaviour by designated staff. As a rule, this should occur daily, but more-frequent observations might be warranted, during experimentation or when fish are ill or have a physical deficit. It is imperative that, appropriate methods be in place for disease monitoring and diagnosis.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "b33b77d4ff42acae3d82c3d517fdf038",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "335a90619eefb727eda0b282aafce631",
"text": "Post-mortem examination and signs of illness, distress, or other deviations from normal health conditions in fish should be reported promptly to ensure appropriate and timely delivery of veterinary care. Fish that show signs of a contagious disease should be isolated from healthy fish.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "b33b77d4ff42acae3d82c3d517fdf038",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "af67eaece8815ff460dfcbbcb245a4a0",
"text": "The isolation, quarantine and stabilization programs for newly arrived fish are necessary to provide time to assess their health status, allow, them to recover from the stress of shipment and an opportunity to adapt to their new environment. The extent of these programs depends on several factors, including species and source of the fish as well as their intended use.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "b33b77d4ff42acae3d82c3d517fdf038",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "2731617f99c0611d58c232e468f8dfe9",
"text": "3.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "b33b77d4ff42acae3d82c3d517fdf038",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "3d0ba6c019908e5d30c76a0310ecc43e",
"text": "4. Only fish of defined health status should be used in research and testing unless a specific, naturally occurring or induced disease state is being studied. Systems should be established to protect fish within the institution from",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"parent_id": "b33b77d4ff42acae3d82c3d517fdf038",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "4aa40a08ef51d02f5b5cffdb63a1db47",
"text": "14",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 17,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "76864aa1ae2020a31ce270502530837d",
"text": "exposure to diseases.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "91b90fdd516be403606e6bdb80ae594a",
"text": "Transgenic and mutant fish may be particularly susceptible to diseases and may require special protection to ensure their health. Systems to prevent spread of disease may include facility design features, containment/isolation tanks, and use of standard operating procedures. Training of fish care personnel and research staff is essential to prevent spread of fish diseases.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "ab91249283db1b23eb87135bbcd75ef3",
"text": "5.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "388e7f00f3e49295a12d8b59d4ab0a99",
"text": "6. Disease surveillance is a major responsibility of the veterinarian/fish care staff and should include routine monitoring of fish for the presence of parasitic and microbiological agents that may cause overt or inapparent disease. The type and intensity of monitoring necessary will depend upon the professional veterinary judgment and the species, source, use and number of fish housed and used in the facility.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "694c2cc778b2ac1f1742410f5ded03c6",
"text": "7. Diagnostic laboratory services must be available and used as appropriate. Laboratory services should include necropsy, histopathology, microbiology, hematology (Annexure 6), clinical pathology (Annexure 7), serology, parasitology, and other routine or specialized laboratory procedures, as needed. It is not necessary that all of these services be available within the institutional facilities. Facilities from other laboratories with appropriate capabilities can be used.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "52d5f706c3a196d01e60c300c360d405",
"text": "Fish showing the signs of infectious/contagious diseases must be isolated from others by placing them in isolation units in separate rooms appropriate for the containment of the agents of concern. In certain circumstances, when an entire group of fish are known or suspected to be exposed or infected, it may be appropriate to keep the group intact during the time necessary for diagnosis and treatment, for taking other control measures, or for completion of a project.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "5c028b74b80428897b18f5d921abd6f3",
"text": "The veterinarian must have authority to use appropriate treatment or control measures, including euthanasia following diagnosis of fish disease or injury. If possible, the veterinarian should discuss the situation with the principal investigator to determine a course of action consistent with experimental goals. However, if the principal investigator is not available, or if agreement cannot be reached, the veterinarian must have authority to act to protect the health and wellbeing of the institutional fish stock.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "bb9aa38c57e9506fc24bf0af9dd27d45",
"text": "9.

If possible, the veterinarian should discuss the situation with the principal investigator to determine a course of action consistent with experimental goals. However, if the principal investigator is not available, or if agreement cannot be reached, the veterinarian must have authority to act to protect the health and wellbeing of the institutional fish stock.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "bb9aa38c57e9506fc24bf0af9dd27d45",
"text": "9.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "2776d94624d732101371e81ce1ff3d8f",
"text": "10",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "b0c226bbcbdbc1471580237f7a095e46",
"text": "It is mandatory that all facilities must have a fish health monitoring program. For disease prevention, strategic measures should include: i. a program for the detection and management of disease conditions and",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "cdb7616cf928978b785bf48168df9915",
"text": "a program for the detection and management of disease conditions and monitor water quality problems related to physiological stress,",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "594fc6b62a1990631ddd2d11149a9ed2",
"text": "monitor water quality problems related to physiological stress, ii. a system for regular monitoring and reporting of health assessment, iii. Details on the strategic application of disease control measures, like quarantine, immunization, and prophylactic treatments a formal written",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "98e9174d736ac500bf2149f5c9a17d02",
"text": "15",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 18,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"text": "iv.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "63c2f84c6f3b3490a4145cbd07b6168a",
"text": "delegation of responsibility to be given to the fish health care professional for the management and monitoring of morbidity and mortality in the facility. In order to have correct control measures, due consideration on early diagnosis and identification of the causal agents besides factors leading to stress must be introduced.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "18ed357b08c4a30d84ee2d5a7084bb7d",
"text": "v. As a result of experimental stress, due consideration must be given to identify clinical as well as subclinical pathogens.

In order to have correct control measures, due consideration on early diagnosis and identification of the causal agents besides factors leading to stress must be introduced.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "18ed357b08c4a30d84ee2d5a7084bb7d",
"text": "v. As a result of experimental stress, due consideration must be given to identify clinical as well as subclinical pathogens.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "4b3e8d0d26899db752cbfa377856f43a",
"text": "vi. After any potentially stressful event, fish must be closely monitored. vii. Fish should be handled only by competent or trained personnel in order to avoid or minimize potential injury and pain. Morbidity and mortality in the experimental fish as a result of compromise in osmoregulation, systemic acidosis, and opportunistic infections of damaged skin because of handling and traumatic injuries should be reduced to a minimum.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "bedffb27d3248c0419bf14350249bc18",
"text": "viii. Standard Operating Procedures must be in place for standard treatment methods with inclusion of defined endpoints if fish are adversely affected. Health management procedure must exclude behavioral interactions such as aggression.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "efbdce6d73e290ad2d53ae24f70c6c3b",
"text": "10. FISH HEALTH A good understanding of Zebrafish biology and behaviour, including diseases, clinical signs and treatments, is necessary to minimize suffering or death. Zebrafish should be regularly monitored for signs of ill health. The following are a few of the important resources for information on diseases in Zebrafish (Reed and Jennings, 2010): 1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "63299bef7b7375b80a2226f6bee6d7ae",
"text": "Zebrafish http://zebrafish.org/zirc/health/diseaseManual.php Laboratory Animal Medicine (2002) (Second edition) American College of Laboratory Animal Medicine Series The Laboratory Fish (2000) - Gary K. Ostrander (editor) Academic Press, San Diego",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "134e72a122dd8320116945f564cfa67a",
"text": "2.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "b38923e42162b3fb73bc5ba82011f4da",
"text": "3.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "652899418061d36f09bd5163b17af37d",
"text": "The maximal recorded life-span of Zebrafish in the laboratory is 5½ years, though an average of 3½ years has been reported (Gerhard et al., 2002). In laboratories, these animals are routinely kept for 18 months to two years, after which they are considered to be of lower reproductive value and also prone to develop diseases. In the wild, there is little evidence that individuals survive more than a year or two. This may be due to predation or parasites (Spence, 2007).",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "f12cddf22b60f88621453d88acbdf3ad",
"text": "The following are important resources for those using Zebrafish:",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "569ed97efb1494c135713598bc4d53d1",
"text": "1. Zebrafish Husbandry Association (ZHA) www.zhaonline.org 2. British Association for Zebrafish Husbandry (BAZH) www.bazh.co.uk 3. Zebrafish Information Network - the Zebrafish model organism database",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ab3b36a4224ef186b9f512b0858a83ef",
"text": "(ZFIN) http://zfin.org/zf_info/dbase/db.html",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "c15b782ffc023d2b9620ac2a9d88f20c",
"text": "4.

Zebrafish Resource International ttp://zebrafish.org/zirc/home/guide.php Center (ZIRC)",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"parent_id": "3124738d64c5ff4d37794b412619c384",

"type": "Title",
"element_id": "4b0f4a06e05f556c8709ef497c989bb4",
"text": "h",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "d32edf5dec0fbb610b318e4ba1f652e2",
"text": "16",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 19,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "dbd4ac3fecebcb91bc42e45ccdfcde62",
"text": "5. European Zebrafish Resource Centre (EZRC) https://www.ezrc.kit.edu/",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "a3f379e5c2f0411c06897d43b6944275",
"text": "The following book will also be of interest:",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "23c9d5556f98f4fb004b9f1cac909aee",
"text": "1. The Laboratory Zebrafish (2010) Claudia Harper & Christian Lawrence; CRC Press, Boca Raton, USA.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ca1c00e27a1c1e4078f813d41e1f9ce6",
"text": "2. Zebrafish, Practical Approach (2005), Edited by Christiane Nusslein-Volhard and Ralf Dahm,Oxford University Press.",

"element_id": "c36619b6a49d83df61a4c0182ab9c5b4",
"text": "3. Zebrafish in Biomedical Research. Biology, Husbandry, Diseases and Research Applications. Academic press (2020)",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "8e41c05117de6cc1d815aad92767bde3",
"text": "11. PERSONNEL AND TRAINING",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "5c540d7c9bae432bef0f5e80e6efe25c",
"text": "Fish care programs require technical and husbandry support. Institutions should employ people trained in fishery science or provide both formal and on-the-job training to ensure effective implementation of the programs.

PERSONNEL AND TRAINING",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "5c540d7c9bae432bef0f5e80e6efe25c",
"text": "Fish care programs require technical and husbandry support. Institutions should employ people trained in fishery science or provide both formal and on-the-job training to ensure effective implementation of the programs.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "8e41c05117de6cc1d815aad92767bde3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "7579e0f0daeb702215be2e77c11b4c31",
"text": "The selection of staff particularly working in fish sheds, farm, fish aquarium in the and those involved in transportation, is a critical component management of a fish facility.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "8e41c05117de6cc1d815aad92767bde3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "7a93134486f2a3445bdeebfbd425738e",
"text": "1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "8e41c05117de6cc1d815aad92767bde3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "703cd88ff9f74096a94c2d137c55297d",
"text": "The staff must be provided with all required protective clothing (gloves, gumboots, other footwear etc.) while working in fish house. Facilities should be provided for change over with lockers, washbasin, toilets and bathrooms to maintain personal hygiene. It is also important to have a regular medical check-up programs arranged for the workers to ensure that they have not picked up any zoonotic infection and also that they are not acting as a source of transmission of infection to the fish.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "8e41c05117de6cc1d815aad92767bde3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "9df97873c754f76482d346fda0ff3bc7",
"text": "2.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "8e41c05117de6cc1d815aad92767bde3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "5432da15c16f6d126b4183eaf064c15f",
"text": "3.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "8e41c05117de6cc1d815aad92767bde3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "fc571c4f3f3867b82022910d7f14bfac",
"text": "Initial in-house training of staff at all levels is essential. A few weeks must be spent on the training of the newly recruited staff, teaching them the handling techniques, live diet preparation and feeding cleaning of tanks/tubs/boxes/ racks, and importance of hygiene, disinfection and sterilization. They should also be made familiar with the behavioural activities of normal healthy and sick fish so that, they will be able to spot the sick fish during their daily routine check-up of tanks .

A few weeks must be spent on the training of the newly recruited staff, teaching them the handling techniques, live diet preparation and feeding cleaning of tanks/tubs/boxes/ racks, and importance of hygiene, disinfection and sterilization. They should also be made familiar with the behavioural activities of normal healthy and sick fish so that, they will be able to spot the sick fish during their daily routine check-up of tanks .",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "8e41c05117de6cc1d815aad92767bde3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "2ab249f9ccb9d9bbc2660284945ab41f",
"text": "12. PERSONAL HYGIENE",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "efd017ebf4b135bef59e0b9513cd65f4",
"text": "1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "2ab249f9ccb9d9bbc2660284945ab41f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "9997fb65745a92e2c080f002acb1f230",
"text": "It is essential that the fish health care staff maintain a high standard of personal cleanliness. Facilities and supplies for meeting this obligation should be provided with appropriate Personnel Protective Equipment (PPE) e.g. showers, change of uniforms, footwear etc.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "2ab249f9ccb9d9bbc2660284945ab41f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "a7cdfd9ccfa8fae13ab3cc9989882763",
"text": "2. Clothing suitable for use in the fish facility should be supplied and laundered by the institution. A commercial laundering service can be engaged for",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "2ab249f9ccb9d9bbc2660284945ab41f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "0da383be4a67f0c9e72cc123ff770ecc",
"text": "17",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 20,
"parent_id": "2ab249f9ccb9d9bbc2660284945ab41f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "b892c641ccb21a076c5a9ea237cb6bb7",
"text": "services; however, institutional facilities should be used to decontaminate clothing exposed to potentially hazardous microbial agents or toxic substances. It is acceptable to use disposable gloves, masks, head covers, coats, overalls and shoe covers. Personnel should change clothing as often as is necessary to maintain personal hygiene. Outer garments worn in the fish shed should not be worn outside the fish facility.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "2ab249f9ccb9d9bbc2660284945ab41f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ed2c1cbc580075a1003b4740302e50a0",
"text": "3. Washing and showering facilities appropriate to the program should be available. Personnel should not be permitted to eat, drink, smoke or apply cosmetics and perfumes in fish rooms. A separate area or room should be made available for these purposes.

Personnel should change clothing as often as is necessary to maintain personal hygiene. Outer garments worn in the fish shed should not be worn outside the fish facility.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "2ab249f9ccb9d9bbc2660284945ab41f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ed2c1cbc580075a1003b4740302e50a0",
"text": "3. Washing and showering facilities appropriate to the program should be available. Personnel should not be permitted to eat, drink, smoke or apply cosmetics and perfumes in fish rooms. A separate area or room should be made available for these purposes.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "2ab249f9ccb9d9bbc2660284945ab41f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "3a393482807701dabda48e30bf3aba86",
"text": "13. FISH EXPERIMENTATION INVOLVING HAZARDOUS AGENTS",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "c6bbc1291f704417e2846de5a007db73",
"text": "1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "3a393482807701dabda48e30bf3aba86",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "5908fb824817b44a300668fa18aef533",
"text": "Institutions should have policies governing experimentation with hazardous agents. Ensure Institutional Bio-safety Committee whose members are knowledgeable about hazardous agents for taking care of safety issues.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "3a393482807701dabda48e30bf3aba86",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "fb2a1eb901a37af5471f8942e0c326b3",
"text": "2.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "3a393482807701dabda48e30bf3aba86",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "bf2b0e67e3986522cb6ba650fbf21c1f",
"text": "Since the use of fish in such studies requires special considerations, the procedures to be used and the facilities must be reviewed by both the Institutional Bio-safety committee and Institutional Animal Ethics Committee (IAEC). Disposing of tissues and fluids from such used fish must also be appropriately governed as per the laid standard practices in the bio- safety regulations.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "3a393482807701dabda48e30bf3aba86",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "b50d0e9caacd0d57f219ed8dae3252a9",
"text": "14. DURATIONS OF EXPERIMENTS",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "d4ade2f795d574cae7a34b23ad44211d",
"text": "No fish should be used for experimentation for more than two years unless adequate justification is provided.

DURATIONS OF EXPERIMENTS",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "d4ade2f795d574cae7a34b23ad44211d",
"text": "No fish should be used for experimentation for more than two years unless adequate justification is provided.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "b50d0e9caacd0d57f219ed8dae3252a9",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "bffaf773ffb2e0dc070fc252c8504c5f",
"text": "15. PHYSICAL RESTRAINT",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "89a33f3c58b86a063dd3a8b887879400",
"text": "1. Minimum physical restraint of fish for physical examination, collection of samples, and a variety of other clinical and experimental manipulations can be accomplished manually or with devices of suitable size and design to minimize stress and avoid injury.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "bffaf773ffb2e0dc070fc252c8504c5f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "9edc1d8ae666f7b1de5d16e384e65e3d",
"text": "Prolonged restraint of any fish, should be avoided unless essential to the research objectives.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "bffaf773ffb2e0dc070fc252c8504c5f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "73aee349427838329180134a255d914d",
"text": "Following points should be considered during handling and restraining fish:",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "bffaf773ffb2e0dc070fc252c8504c5f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "5cf4ea83293a8720765fb71be8237745",
"text": "3.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "bffaf773ffb2e0dc070fc252c8504c5f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "dc964c1d32e9cb86d6e6e9c51afec8b9",
"text": "i. Fish should be handled by competent individuals trained in methods that do not cause distress and injury.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "bffaf773ffb2e0dc070fc252c8504c5f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "825e8f87ec55bee6590596c7496bffd1",
"text": "ii. The use of restraint devices sometimes essential for the welfare of the fish and safety of the handler.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "bffaf773ffb2e0dc070fc252c8504c5f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "825e8f87ec55bee6590596c7496bffd1",
"text": "ii. The use of restraint devices sometimes essential for the welfare of the fish and safety of the handler. Restraint devices should be used to the",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"parent_id": "bffaf773ffb2e0dc070fc252c8504c5f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "ab09fa602644caf030ed05a4b57c041a",
"text": "18",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 21,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "472ccc8a0f6bcac7bba06a298eb0ddd2",
"text": "minimum extent, for the minimum period required to accomplish the purpose of the experiment and be appropriate for the fish.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "8900b39bcd5bcce22d63bb074529a549",
"text": "4.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "9545ee571730c28a23ff64051f9d8a79",
"text": "The following are important guidelines for the use of restraint equipment: Restraint devices cannot be used simply as a convenience to handle fish. The period of restraint should be minimum to accomplish the research objectives. Staff should be given training to adapt to the equipment prior to initiation of experimentation.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "ca7cca83af5e24979579448ae30842ca",
"text": "i.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "8a8d33062f9172e3b21b353cc1a71a54",
"text": "ii.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "3f631c80ff8742b871acc54ee5337184",
"text": "Provision should be made for observation of fish at appropriate intervals. Veterinary care should be provided if symptoms of stress or illness observed during restraint period. On noticing any illness, or severe behavioural changes fish should be removed temporarily or permanently from restraint related protocols.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "8a8d33062f9172e3b21b353cc1a71a54",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"text": "16.

Veterinary care should be provided if symptoms of stress or illness observed during restraint period. On noticing any illness, or severe behavioural changes fish should be removed temporarily or permanently from restraint related protocols.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "8a8d33062f9172e3b21b353cc1a71a54",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"text": "16. LOCATION OF FISH FACILITIES TO LABORATORIES",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "6051c16b9df7c851cf9b120b70d092bf",
"text": "1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "6cb8b3fcdbc771f7c67ccd61b1dae08d",
"text": "Fish facilities should be physically separated from personnel areas such as offices, break room, training and education rooms. This will ensure good fish husbandry practices and ensure human comfort and prevent disease transmission.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "43022dcb2971dc0417ec38af208c0e84",
"text": "2.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "9c2cbf57baba4ffe166f245f47df3f4e",
"text": "Fish are very sensitive to their living conditions. It is important that they shall be housed in an isolated building located as far away from human habitation as possible and not exposed to dust, smoke, noise, wild rodents, and insects. The building, aquatic systems, tanks/cages and environment of fish rooms are the major factors, which affect the quality of fish.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "9352b7a225a75cfeffa3927be8a3503e",
"text": "3.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "8f4b846e7052540ec4b8ccb8534e4d31",
"text": "This separation can be accomplished by having the fish rooms separately. Careful planning should make it possible to place fish rooms adjacent to or near laboratories, but separated from them by barriers such as entry locks, corridors, or floors.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "8f4b846e7052540ec4b8ccb8534e4d31",
"text": "This separation can be accomplished by having the fish rooms separately. Careful planning should make it possible to place fish rooms adjacent to or near laboratories, but separated from them by barriers such as entry locks, corridors, or floors.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ee431cab990c7974105df87bd65a4586",
"text": "4. While planning experimental fish facility, space should be well divided for different activities. The fish rooms should occupy about 50-60% of the total constructed area and the remaining area should be utilized for services such as stores, washing areas, office and staff, machine rooms, isolation, quarantine and corridors. The environment of fish rooms (Macro- Environment) and fish tank/cage (Microenvironment) are factors on which the production and experimental efficiency of the fish depends. Since fish are very sensitive to environmental changes, sharp, fluctuations in temperature, humidity, light, sound and ventilation should be avoided.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"parent_id": "233a16107727ed4e1ff863e72643d4df",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "9b51ba7086e6719a94debc43d9a2e925",
"text": "19",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 22,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Header",
"element_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"text": "17. FUNCTIONAL AREAS",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "91e4c9e91cc565f3b9202e698d954912",
"text": "1. The size and nature of a facility will determine whether areas for separate services and functions are required or not.

FUNCTIONAL AREAS",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "91e4c9e91cc565f3b9202e698d954912",
"text": "1. The size and nature of a facility will determine whether areas for separate services and functions are required or not. As a minimum, the exclusive Fish areas require to ensure:",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "e8227d0c40b9ca9748d268b0509a1bb2",
"text": "a. Separation of species or isolation of individual projects when necessary;",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "d60b27b303e71eeac1da1fd1e35c760d",
"text": "b. Receipt and quarantine, and isolation of fish; and c. Separate housing for breeding and experimentation",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "a003755491de6218177b25be22d39d26",
"text": "In facilities that are small and intend to maintain very few fish or plans to house 2. fish under specialized conditions (e.g., facilities exclusively used for housing germfree colonies) may not require all the functional areas as listed below. However, a full-fledged independent functional facility with comprehensive multidimentional activities having different species requires them. Professional judgment must be exercised when developing a practically useful system for fish facility based on the need and the intended use.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "baa9a1b87d19b818e6205a3233bd13f7",
"text": "a. Sufficient rooms for housing different species.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ce5bc16e37193d4ef189ff14b4ab8711",
"text": "b. Areas or rooms for activities such as surgery, necropsy, preparation of special diets, experimental manipulations, treatment, and sample collection, diagnostic laboratory, small procedures and containment facilities for handling experiments with infectious / pathogenic organisms.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "01b2ab58afff97dc82c181ccdae2f03c",
"text": "c. Separate rooms and Equipment, for handling of hazardous biological, physical, or chemical agents.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "01b2ab58afff97dc82c181ccdae2f03c",
"text": "c. Separate rooms and Equipment, for handling of hazardous biological, physical, or chemical agents.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ea8954013b5044488bcecd064e53db89",
"text": "d. Specialized laboratories for handling tissues for histopathology and microbiology, health and genetic monitoring and molecular diagnosis laboratories.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "1bd20362dbd25e1999d7e8357d2de0a4",
"text": "e. Room for formulation and storage of Pharmaceuticals, biologics, and supplies.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "c5b8e38909594683eca30ffd74fb029a",
"text": "f. Space for office administration, staff supervision, and room for maintaining records, control rooms for building management.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "3538042619e4183faeb3b2e72d42c184",
"text": "g. Change rooms, Shower areas, lockers and toilets for animal care personnel at entry and exit.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "11b5e9e8f8c1bb972bb79cbe2158cd60",
"text": "h. Area for washing and sterilization of equipment and supplies.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "11b5e9e8f8c1bb972bb79cbe2158cd60",
"text": "h. Area for washing and sterilization of equipment and supplies.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "f671672ff6029ab24cb967e16fdf5eb4",
"text": "i. Separate room and area for receiving and storage of feed",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"parent_id": "e749c5c8de269cbfb1038db8d9857031",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "cc2716486205655c325d1166d188dc0f",
"text": "20",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 23,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "227aebade2d26c61d6b6764079d029fe",
"text": "j. Temporary holding areas for used and cleaned tanks / tubs /boxes and equipment.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "69cb5495e29ba56c54364fe43f5f2a8e",
"text": "k. Area for repairing of utensils and equipment.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "a5d3ac15235baf9ccb742888fda2b8d8",
"text": "l. Area to store wastes and discard material prior to disposal or incineration.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "589525e838fb911787b4beaf9e683301",
"text": "m. There should be adequate and appropriate storage areas for fish tanks, filters, feed, and other accessories.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"text": "18. PHYSICAL FACILITIES",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "35cd80e4ebcb7c0da261325daaa2bee1",
"text": "The physical condition, size and design of fish facilities depend on the scope of institutional research activities. Fish to be housed physically close to the rest of the institution. A well planned and properly maintained facility is an important element in good fish care and to carryout successful research programs.

PHYSICAL FACILITIES",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "35cd80e4ebcb7c0da261325daaa2bee1",
"text": "The physical condition, size and design of fish facilities depend on the scope of institutional research activities. Fish to be housed physically close to the rest of the institution. A well planned and properly maintained facility is an important element in good fish care and to carryout successful research programs. The following points should be considered for housing facility for Fishes:",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"parent_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "fee8f7c37f2bde98eb56d60409c53d63",
"text": "a. Housing facility should be compatible with the needs of the species to be housed.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"parent_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "69cdf745a4d53be2058e5133bf7476db",
"text": "b. Housing Facilities should be designed and operated to facilitate control of environmental factors to exclude vermin and limit contamination associated with the housing of fish, delivery of food, water, and the entry of people and other animals.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"parent_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "a5e118beb899c3b71e6d149fbe4a8f7a",
"text": "c. Housing Facilities should be maintained in good condition. Walls and floors should be constructed with durable materials with surfaces that can withstand to regular cleaning and disinfection.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"parent_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "3da70bff70ca64713ab0c02d916d4661",
"text": "d. Housing Facilities should be kept clean and tidy and operated to achieve maximum possible hygiene.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"parent_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "122531d92d07d3ffe1d5fba18a005040",
"text": "e. There should be a pest control programme. f. Sprays and deodorants that mask the odours should not be used in fish facilities as they may expose fish to volatile compounds which can alter metabolic processes. In addition, deodorants must not be used as a substitute for good cleaning practices and good ventilation.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"parent_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ecfab8af54dd947b754bb0adf467cc34",
"text": "g. Cleaning practices should be monitored on a regular basis to ensure effective hygiene and sanitation. This may include visual inspection, monitoring water temperatures and microbiological testing of surfaces after cleaning.

f. Sprays and deodorants that mask the odours should not be used in fish facilities as they may expose fish to volatile compounds which can alter metabolic processes. In addition, deodorants must not be used as a substitute for good cleaning practices and good ventilation.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"parent_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ecfab8af54dd947b754bb0adf467cc34",
"text": "g. Cleaning practices should be monitored on a regular basis to ensure effective hygiene and sanitation. This may include visual inspection, monitoring water temperatures and microbiological testing of surfaces after cleaning.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"parent_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ca67aca147c77d117119bfb84c83a9dc",
"text": "h. There should be proper water supply and drainage. i. There should be adequate contingency plans to cover such emergencies as flooding and fire, or the breakdown of lighting, heating, cooling or ventilation. In the interest of disease prevention and general fish welfare, access to the Housing Facilities by unauthorized persons should be restricted.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"parent_id": "1f23fb55ec29b7485160f6e981a83a17",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "acb49ee5df4c870fc0a48e560a302649",
"text": "21",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 24,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "1e89e85b14c2d5795e79145a4c7e329c",
"text": "1. Building Materials should be selected to facilitate efficient and hygienic operation of fish facilities. Durable, moisture-proof, fire-resistant, seamless materials are most desirable for interior surfaces including vermin and pest resistance.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "d115eee4afe315feb9a15d0c3c207d9a",
"text": "2. Corridor(s) should be wide enough to facilitate the movement of personnel as well as equipment and should be kept clean.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "cc19ae9395e5aa91b690a7294754fa14",
"text": "3. Utilities such as water lines, drain pipes, and electrical connections should preferably be accessible through service panels or shafts in corridors outside the fish sheds.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "f4f9e5ffa65f89ddac24e979085bf9b4",
"text": "4. Fish room Doors, the material used should not attract rust and should be vermin and dust proof. They should fit properly within their frames. Door closures may also be provided. Rodent barriers can be provided in the doors of the fish facilities/sheds.

Utilities such as water lines, drain pipes, and electrical connections should preferably be accessible through service panels or shafts in corridors outside the fish sheds.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "f4f9e5ffa65f89ddac24e979085bf9b4",
"text": "4. Fish room Doors, the material used should not attract rust and should be vermin and dust proof. They should fit properly within their frames. Door closures may also be provided. Rodent barriers can be provided in the doors of the fish facilities/sheds.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "51add5108734346cc8df321ad76ff1d2",
"text": "5. Floors should be monolithic smooth, moisture-proof, nonabsorbent, antiskid, resistant to wear, acid, solvents and should able to with stand to the regular use of detergents and disinfectants. It should be solid with minimum number of joints, strong enough to support water-filled fish tanks / units, equipment, and stored items without becoming gouged, cracked, or pitted.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "d341f3af57116029259f914a62d77613",
"text": "6. Drains are essential in all rooms wherever fish are housed. The rooms can be maintained satisfactorily by wet vacuuming or mopping with appropriate disinfectants or cleaning compounds. Floors should be given sufficient slope towards drain traps and they should be fitted with SS “P” traps with additional mesh to avoid vermin and wild rodent entry.. The slope in the room should allow rapid removal of water and drying of surfaces.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "9522a48e7c7539df5aadf02d60f663d9",
"text": "7. Walls & Ceilings should be free of cracks, unsealed utility penetrations, or imperfect junctions with doors, ceilings, floors and corners.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "cc4ddeb36abfc9ad643c4cc7874ff4f6",
"text": "8. Surface materials should be capable of withstanding scrubbing with detergents, disinfectants and the impact of water under high pressure.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "d1b48a353a08eee75da180b3d7461be1",
"text": "9. Materials used for construction of roof should cater needs of local climatic condition to provide comfort to the fish.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ed8c51640001179314cc84710c2d0b4e",
"text": "10. Storage Areas: Separate storage areas should be designed for feed, unclean and cleaned fish tanks, tubs, boxes, rack, utensils and materials that are not in use. Refrigerated storage, separated from other cold storage, is essential for storage of fish carcasses and fish tissue waste prior to disposal.

Materials used for construction of roof should cater needs of local climatic condition to provide comfort to the fish.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "ed8c51640001179314cc84710c2d0b4e",
"text": "10. Storage Areas: Separate storage areas should be designed for feed, unclean and cleaned fish tanks, tubs, boxes, rack, utensils and materials that are not in use. Refrigerated storage, separated from other cold storage, is essential for storage of fish carcasses and fish tissue waste prior to disposal.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "936be51b6e69727c3cfa4cf318085f94",
"text": "11. Facilities for Sanitizing Equipment and Supplies: Area for sanitizing tanks,tubs/boxes racks, utensils and ancillary equipment is essential with",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "3e59252d3d50b8c2d3acddac994adb73",
"text": "22",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 25,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "bb9fa0fd849ab540708f59532a12a6a9",
"text": "adequate water supply.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "b20e7e1626f2c6c12d4c8f83105eb14e",
"text": "12. Experimental Area: All experimental procedures in fish should be carried out in a separate area away from the place where fish are housed.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "a099069a727b179b7639beb7c9ef8ce8",
"text": "19. SANITATION AND CLEANLINESS:",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "8db4ac4eaa534ac750cbd1d8719be1e6",
"text": "1. Sanitation is an essential activity in a fish house. Fish tanks, corridors, storage spaces, and other areas should be properly cleaned with appropriate detergents and disinfectants as often as necessary to keep them free of dirt, debris, and harmful agents of contamination.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"parent_id": "a099069a727b179b7639beb7c9ef8ce8",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "e527eee132ef5d53d1cf10703bd0d0da",
"text": "2. Tankstubs/boxes and racks should be sanitized before fish are placed in them. Fish tanks, tubs/boxes, racks, utensils and accessories such as lids, baffles, filters should be washed and sanitized frequently to keep them clean and contamination and odour free.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"parent_id": "a099069a727b179b7639beb7c9ef8ce8",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "e527eee132ef5d53d1cf10703bd0d0da",
"text": "2. Tankstubs/boxes and racks should be sanitized before fish are placed in them. Fish tanks, tubs/boxes, racks, utensils and accessories such as lids, baffles, filters should be washed and sanitized frequently to keep them clean and contamination and odour free.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"parent_id": "a099069a727b179b7639beb7c9ef8ce8",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "6662ee945f2eee5006c5344dd0982be7",
"text": "3. Disinfection can be accomplished with appropriate chemicals that are time tested for toxic products. Tanks, tubs, boxes, racks and accessories should be rinsed with fresh and sterile water for making them free of chemicals prior to use. Periodic microbiologic monitoring is recommended to determine the efficacy of disinfection or sterilization procedures.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"parent_id": "a099069a727b179b7639beb7c9ef8ce8",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "c942287472fcde8c04308cf85077f844",
"text": "4. Some means for sterilizing equipment and supplies, such as an autoclave or gas sterilizer, is essential when experiments are performed with pathogenic organisms. Routine sterilization of tankstubs/boxes, is also essential besides care is taken to use clean materials from reliable sources. Where hazardous biological, chemical, or physical agents are used, a system of regular equipment monitoring is recommended.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"parent_id": "a099069a727b179b7639beb7c9ef8ce8",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "ec605c2941f5a92c92c85e645d2c0e00",
"text": "20. ASSESSING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SANITATION",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "db4e830e52585a7bb454174d4aab5cd7",
"text": "1. Sanitation practices should be monitored appropriately to ensure the effectiveness of the process and materials being used for cleaning; it can include visual inspection of the materials, monitoring of water temperatures, or microbiologic monitoring.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"parent_id": "ec605c2941f5a92c92c85e645d2c0e00",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "163a69c1a70be28e2a98e7df2df0cf02",
"text": "2. A decision to change the frequency of tanktubs / rack washing should be based on factors such as the loss of transparency due to algae growth, formation of rust, biofilm or accumulation of fecal/uneaten feed in the tanks/tubs.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"parent_id": "ec605c2941f5a92c92c85e645d2c0e00",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "163a69c1a70be28e2a98e7df2df0cf02",
"text": "2. A decision to change the frequency of tanktubs / rack washing should be based on factors such as the loss of transparency due to algae growth, formation of rust, biofilm or accumulation of fecal/uneaten feed in the tanks/tubs.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"parent_id": "ec605c2941f5a92c92c85e645d2c0e00",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "2c16740c13efb3fc3cec6f6303692136",
"text": "21. WASTE DISPOSAL",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "66a38ebee0f1c12119eecd11e0c797eb",
"text": "1. Wastes should be removed regularly and frequently. All waste should be collected and disposed off in a safe and sanitary manner. Filter pads, bags,",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"parent_id": "2c16740c13efb3fc3cec6f6303692136",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "ac3bc21014ba11bf5d5fb3ca7255a367",
"text": "23",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 26,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "0e0afd4753d191bb250312f03937671b",
"text": "cartridges and charcoal should be treated with a bleach solution before disposal. Fish carcasses, tissue, blood and any infectious materials should be incinerated. Incinerators should be in compliance with all central, state, and local Public Health and Pollution Control Board regulations.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "e5b043bf49a4ece9ea6230824767d582",
"text": "2. Waste containers containing animal tissues, carcasses, and hazardous wastes should be lined with leak-proof, disposable liners. If wastes must be stored before removal, the waste storage areas should be separated from other storage facilities and free of flies, cockroaches, rodents, and other vermin. Cold storage is necessary to prevent the decomposition of biological wastes. Hazardous wastes should be rendered safe by disinfection, decontamination, or other appropriate means before they are disposed off from the fish facility.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "7e63b5309efaadd65efa501928a1f7e6",
"text": "22. EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES a. Handling and Restraint 1.

If wastes must be stored before removal, the waste storage areas should be separated from other storage facilities and free of flies, cockroaches, rodents, and other vermin. Cold storage is necessary to prevent the decomposition of biological wastes. Hazardous wastes should be rendered safe by disinfection, decontamination, or other appropriate means before they are disposed off from the fish facility.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "7e63b5309efaadd65efa501928a1f7e6",
"text": "22. EXPERIMENTAL PROCEDURES a. Handling and Restraint 1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "f0e96ed0c70b3e0dde45e9dcfb22f5c8",
"text": "Personnel involved in handling fish should undergo extensive training to ensure that, they are well trained to avoid injury and morbidity to fishes during care.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "bc86fd5daa51117fbc45fcab4d82d6f8",
"text": "2. Restraint and handling should be carried out in a way to avoid visual stimulation and damage to their mucus-skin barrier.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "5e0b543cc4f642d55946c2b3bb8589f9",
"text": "3. As far as possible, direct light and rapid changes in temperature and lighting should be avoided, and fish should not be kept in the air continuously for more than 30 seconds.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "d712a710461ae80d28a684fbc638e134",
"text": "4. Only adequately trained and competent individuals should be permitted to work with dangerous emergency items for which appropriate first aid must be available.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "d2ccd6bc46c988216a7bfc48aaed636e",
"text": "b. Restricted Environments 1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "a82db7185b0948b7cc986259cb6027a3",
"text": "Fish should be held in restricted environments that are non-stressful as far as possible. The environment should comply with the constraints of the experimental design.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"parent_id": "d2ccd6bc46c988216a7bfc48aaed636e",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "97eb4858ef39c498aed0782661265a22",
"text": "2.

The environment should comply with the constraints of the experimental design.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"parent_id": "d2ccd6bc46c988216a7bfc48aaed636e",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "97eb4858ef39c498aed0782661265a22",
"text": "2.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"parent_id": "d2ccd6bc46c988216a7bfc48aaed636e",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "2c42c20b04a84519bc18f321e9ce6472",
"text": "Surgery",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "c7b2f6849fd791f0781122012356f5fc",
"text": "c. 1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"parent_id": "2c42c20b04a84519bc18f321e9ce6472",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "f9ed8f2950397971f61934b20ae10f1f",
"text": "Surgery Individuals with appropriate training should only be allowed to carry out surgery in fish. In order to achieve the best outcome of surgery, procedure of surgical technique and suture should be practiced on inanimate material or dead specimens until perfection is attained so that there are good chances for the recovery of fish following surgery. Surgical sites should be arranged in a fashion so that tissue damage and contamination of wound areas is minimised.",
"metadata": {
