"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"parent_id": "2c42c20b04a84519bc18f321e9ce6472",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "57cd6f3dd654b361b8bd62eb2dee16cf",
"text": "2.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"parent_id": "2c42c20b04a84519bc18f321e9ce6472",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "b130fecefeeae3fd7510936e6589b051",
"text": "3.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"parent_id": "2c42c20b04a84519bc18f321e9ce6472",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "183011ef0e294da9d15bff7d84dcee0f",
"text": "4. Asepsis and disinfection should be given due importance while performing any kind of surgery. Sterile instruments must be used to avoid contamination of wound while maximizing the healing.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"parent_id": "2c42c20b04a84519bc18f321e9ce6472",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "183011ef0e294da9d15bff7d84dcee0f",
"text": "4. Asepsis and disinfection should be given due importance while performing any kind of surgery. Sterile instruments must be used to avoid contamination of wound while maximizing the healing.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"parent_id": "2c42c20b04a84519bc18f321e9ce6472",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "bcca4b721d44c39bfbff3121ea4c53b0",
"text": "24",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 27,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "d3f8278f85b9c81cb1b7920833086b69",
"text": "5. Water quality should be maintained at a high level, with minimal bacterial and organic burden during prolonged surgery. In order to minimize shock caused by differences in temperature, pH, and electrolytes water for anesthesia, water should be from the same source as the tank water.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "c74dd28b4c8987549edc1ca0bec0dbbf",
"text": "6. Use of anesthetics is recommended for experiments where noxious stimuli are expected and experiments involving extensive handling or to minimize trauma and physiological stress.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "c74f0c172ecd371d51adcd116645b67d",
"text": "7. Documented anesthetics should be used on the basis of their ability to provide predictable results, like immobilization, analgesia, rapid induction and recovery, besides ensuring safety for the fish and the operators (Annexure 8).",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "f6804f1a4c690d206c80dc61669894fd",
"text": "8. Anesthetics should be first tested on a small sample of fish. The anesthetic capability should be determined in local water conditions, as well as the species, life stage, and size of the fish before the experiment. Personnel working with anesthetic agents in fish must be adequately trained and protected with recommended personal protective equipment (PPE) as per the requirement of the experiment. Incisions on the lateral line should be avoided rather than follow the longitudinal axis of the fish.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "3a308fd30451ec078a5311e18d2cf360",
"text": "11. Non-hygroscopic strong and inert monofilament suture material and atraumatic",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "a6f28806a8a942296246127890f1fb38",
"text": "needles should be used for closing the incisions.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "3a308fd30451ec078a5311e18d2cf360",
"text": "11. Non-hygroscopic strong and inert monofilament suture material and atraumatic",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "a6f28806a8a942296246127890f1fb38",
"text": "needles should be used for closing the incisions. In Zebrafish tail fin clipping for genotyping or experimental purposes should be carried out under sedation or light anesthesia.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "e553e662b495f004cc52e411a3df55f4",
"text": "12",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "197a2b0d13d436d3753cb56b08e21618",
"text": "13. Following surgery, fish must be closely observed and monitored both under laboratory or applicable field situations.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "a4bbc5b7498854c85ba3119c3b34416f",
"text": "14. Post-surgery, fish should be held in an environment that reduces or eliminates living intraspecific conditions. interactions in tanks, besides meeting appropriate",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "220edce34d7c90af23b16c3e0aa088ea",
"text": "15. Post-surgery, the use of prophylactic antibiotics should be cautiously evaluated. For maintaining common groups of recovering fish, factors, such as size differences, ability to feed or exclude other fish from feed and, agonistic behavior, should be considered in experimental design.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"text": "d. Administration of Compounds and Devices by Various Routes 1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "9e9761fa5335b0f491d1800f34d6e84a",
"text": "For oral administration of compounds, the dose rate of a compound to be administered should not exceed 1% of the bodyweight (1 mL/100 g).",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "94b504047a87975a829b6a2968387879",
"text": "2. While injecting intramuscular, the needle should be introduced in spaces between the scales. Large dorsal epaxial and abdominal muscles should be preferred avoiding the lateral line and ventral blood vessels.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "94b504047a87975a829b6a2968387879",
"text": "2. While injecting intramuscular, the needle should be introduced in spaces between the scales. Large dorsal epaxial and abdominal muscles should be preferred avoiding the lateral line and ventral blood vessels. For intraperitoneal (IP) injections care should be taken to avoid penetration in to abdominal viscera as it may be inflammatory and lead to formation of adhesion. Implants should be implanted using sterile techniques, biocompatible, and aseptic.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "ce4ccc7f2c2b8a7daa7a7759d78f3d54",
"text": "3.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "0524517efc4aeb93882ba32b5776c27f",
"text": "4.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "e9941da9b6437759318334af566d70e7",
"text": "e. 1. Marking methods should preferably be non-invasive and must be minimized.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "92f9fa2316078e52a75cbda6ac9260ea",
"text": "25",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 28,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "227fddcefb821267d9737f6e51726add",
"text": "It must be ensured that the marking should remain visible for the entire duration of the study.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "4a031119d4ccd70d87479c80a5f06e5f",
"text": "2. Adverse effects of marking and tagging can lead to behavioral changes, changes in physiology or survival of individual experimental fish should be carefully considered. Pilot study should be carried out if effects of markings are not known for a particular species.

",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "4a031119d4ccd70d87479c80a5f06e5f",
"text": "2. Adverse effects of marking and tagging can lead to behavioral changes, changes in physiology or survival of individual experimental fish should be carefully considered. Pilot study should be carried out if effects of markings are not known for a particular species.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "9557eb25d82df626dad6629dd1bed688",
"text": "3. Marking techniques causing substantial injuries to tissue, like, branding, tattooing or clip- ping important fins should be avoided but under exceptional circumstances, it may be used by an investigator after providing adequate justification to animal ethics committee indicating why alternative methods cannot be used.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "2d5068bb27bf25c5db5bd512dc4fa6c1",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "af74cc388a65a02ec0422e1f62b04a3c",
"text": "f.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "1a402136eeb751560bbc439cd148b583",
"text": "Collection of Body Fluids To restrain fish for collection or cannulation purposes, sedation or anesthesia should be used. However, there may be alteration in physiological parameters like serum glucose and several hormone levels.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "af74cc388a65a02ec0422e1f62b04a3c",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "936f9a793a9fe1228ca4820c4bc5af0d",
"text": "g. 1.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "af74cc388a65a02ec0422e1f62b04a3c",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "28e0ae9cb6ecf7dbf8a0b3a101479d02",
"text": "Endpoints and Criteria for Early Euthanasia Possible pain and distress should be eliminated or mitigated by the investigators on their experimental subjects whenever is achievable employing good scientific practice. For studies involving potential pain or distress, pilot studies should be conducted to identify desired clinical signs that may be used as an endpoint for establishing appropriate monitoring. Parameters must be set to document assessment of health status when experiments with defined early pre-lethal endpoints are to be conducted. 4. Criteria for early euthanasia should be clearly defined for studies where",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "af74cc388a65a02ec0422e1f62b04a3c",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "78557e10a7102d5d5c0786ad18f941d0",
"text": "2.

For studies involving potential pain or distress, pilot studies should be conducted to identify desired clinical signs that may be used as an endpoint for establishing appropriate monitoring. Parameters must be set to document assessment of health status when experiments with defined early pre-lethal endpoints are to be conducted. 4. Criteria for early euthanasia should be clearly defined for studies where",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "af74cc388a65a02ec0422e1f62b04a3c",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "78557e10a7102d5d5c0786ad18f941d0",
"text": "2.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "af74cc388a65a02ec0422e1f62b04a3c",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "468f22b4e31a48c28432f59e5a13706e",
"text": "3.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "af74cc388a65a02ec0422e1f62b04a3c",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "5014d718f104eee29f3d4f0227b8dc14",
"text": "morbidity and mortality are expected.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "af74cc388a65a02ec0422e1f62b04a3c",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "ac2639868dad6c011531e2fb784690be",
"text": "h. Monitoring",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "7939731dbf0ebca80699a3d904a11ade",
"text": "Experimental fish must be monitored daily at least once which may depend on the requirement of study as well as the time of morbidity. Moreover, the frequency of monitoring should be synchronized in such a way that there should be ample time for the removal of the fish before severe morbidity. Experiments with predicted high mortality should be monitored more frequently.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "ac2639868dad6c011531e2fb784690be",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "94d8e23f0769508a2883d0bc12dd43a5",
"text": "i.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "f47fe4ef60477ad3bc34e82b77b65eb0",
"text": "Exercise to Exhaustion Exhaustion studies in fish must strictly comply as per the guidelines. Fish used for experiments involving the forced swimming should be subjected to minimum distress to the point of exhaustion in conjunction with negative reinforcement.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "94d8e23f0769508a2883d0bc12dd43a5",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "93c14e34d20cbc49ff728dc3b2f8350e",
"text": "j.

Fish used for experiments involving the forced swimming should be subjected to minimum distress to the point of exhaustion in conjunction with negative reinforcement.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "94d8e23f0769508a2883d0bc12dd43a5",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "93c14e34d20cbc49ff728dc3b2f8350e",
"text": "j.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "6911fa2f30b927c6dfe253e37a9b8438",
"text": "Environmental Extremes Earliest endpoint possible should be used for fish subjected to studies involving exposure to environmental extremes.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"parent_id": "93c14e34d20cbc49ff728dc3b2f8350e",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "db2fb212d7b5425066cdcd9bf6f68a7b",
"text": "26",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 29,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "4d5cb702f61542dbc08847b003bae042",
"text": "k. Genetically Modified Fish 1. As a result of genetic alteration, genetically modified fishes may have changes",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "0db2a6c0881e83c8444807d484b9854d",
"text": "in physiology and anatomy and hence there is a need to monitor them closely.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "f7a80e100764ee56d924851c13d24e2f",
"text": "2. Unless going through extensive safety assessment and certification for the authorization of sale, genetically modified fishes must not be permitted to enter the food or feed chain. Such fish can only be introduced with the prior permission of the competent authority, or a Committee for the care and use of animals.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "8c283dc3c14a3a56d95da7704627a326",
"text": "23. EUTHANASIA Euthanasia should be resorted to events where fish are required to be sacrificed to reduce suffering or to limit spread of infections or for termination as part of an experiment or for other ethical reasons. The procedure should be carried out quickly and painlessly in an atmosphere free from fear or anxiety. For accepting the euthanasia method as humane, it should have an initial depressive action on the central nervous system for immediate insensitivity to pain. The choice of a method will depend on the nature of study and species to be killed (Annexure 9). The method should in all cases, meet the following requirements:",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "415478e40cbc48609272265e422f5a96",
"text": "a. Death, without causing anxiety, pain or distress with minimum time lag phase.

The procedure should be carried out quickly and painlessly in an atmosphere free from fear or anxiety. For accepting the euthanasia method as humane, it should have an initial depressive action on the central nervous system for immediate insensitivity to pain. The choice of a method will depend on the nature of study and species to be killed (Annexure 9). The method should in all cases, meet the following requirements:",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "415478e40cbc48609272265e422f5a96",
"text": "a. Death, without causing anxiety, pain or distress with minimum time lag phase.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "8a1d0600486ddbc29c779aa67de3ac3d",
"text": "b. Minimum physiological and psychological disturbances. c.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "e36ec8f635f03105745d1daafe008c59",
"text": "Compatibility with the purpose of the study and minimum emotional effect on the operator Location should be separate from animal rooms and free from environmental contaminants. Two-step euthanasia should be practiced in fishes. An initial step involving anesthesia enabling to reach the point of loss of equilibrium, followed by a physical or chemical method to cause brain death. Physical technique of euthanasia used for killing fish, should involve physical destruction of brain tissue by pithing or crushing the brain. However this requires the additional permission from IAEC.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"parent_id": "8a1d0600486ddbc29c779aa67de3ac3d",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "e1cd22a176a293b1a8923f6e0eed053c",
"text": "d.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "08e13368ff514f93134706f0a87948a5",
"text": "e.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "f3c063526f4a829243f8240fc13fa7a3",
"text": "f.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "b645c0c20eb5f4effac8854868dab84f",
"text": "24. DISPOSITION OF FISH AFTER STUDY a. Consumption of Fish",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"parent_id": "f3c063526f4a829243f8240fc13fa7a3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "cfa9cef857f8a55768a04b839ad03623",
"text": "Fishes to be used for food that were subjected to sedation or anesthesia should be held for adequate withdrawal time before being killed and consumed. In such cases the veterinarian should verify that the fish is safe for consumption.

DISPOSITION OF FISH AFTER STUDY a. Consumption of Fish",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"parent_id": "f3c063526f4a829243f8240fc13fa7a3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "cfa9cef857f8a55768a04b839ad03623",
"text": "Fishes to be used for food that were subjected to sedation or anesthesia should be held for adequate withdrawal time before being killed and consumed. In such cases the veterinarian should verify that the fish is safe for consumption.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"parent_id": "f3c063526f4a829243f8240fc13fa7a3",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "5f7706d229a1df313a9846b72b0289a9",
"text": "b. Release of Fish to Wild",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "707a29a049627cc0b0d4ff6a63f06f7b",
"text": "As a rule of thumb, fish kept in captive environments and used for research must not be released into the wild. Release into the wild can only be permitted as per the National or territorial regulations. Researchers should ensure death of the embryos, larvae or adult fish before disposal. Flushing of embryos and larvae into the sink should be discouraged and disposal is carried out as per state regulations for the biomedical waste. It is also recommended to cover water outlets in sink with wire mesh.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"parent_id": "5f7706d229a1df313a9846b72b0289a9",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "fdedfba9b31be522cc8ad799ed31aa73",
"text": "27",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 30,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "03fc67deb79bb257642ba8e1732a31b7",
"text": "25. PEST CONTROL Adaptation of Programs designed to prevent, control, or eliminate the presence of or infestations by pests are essential in the fish rooms. Best results can be achieved by giving contracts to people/firm specialized in pest control.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "053244e0e6dac49be69cb6cded1054da",
"text": "26. EMERGENCY, WEEKEND AND HOLIDAY CARE",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "386f855aa2f4c016441ba743519a1eb0",
"text": "There should be an institutional policy for the care of fish by qualified personnel every day, including weekends and holidays, to safeguards their well being including emergency health care. In the event of an emergency, institutional security personnel and fire or police officials should be able to reach responsible persons for the fish facility. That can be enhanced by prominently posting emergency procedures, names, or telephone numbers in fish facilities or by placing them in the security department or near telephone. A disaster plan that takes into account both personnel and fish should be prepared as part of the overall safety plan for the fish facility.

In the event of an emergency, institutional security personnel and fire or police officials should be able to reach responsible persons for the fish facility. That can be enhanced by prominently posting emergency procedures, names, or telephone numbers in fish facilities or by placing them in the security department or near telephone. A disaster plan that takes into account both personnel and fish should be prepared as part of the overall safety plan for the fish facility.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"parent_id": "053244e0e6dac49be69cb6cded1054da",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "d168c1cde97b2d3a647dcec743b20854",
"text": "27. RECORD KEEPING",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "5b8be46014a0668569744c6019ffbaf3",
"text": "It is essential that fish House should maintain following records:",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"parent_id": "d168c1cde97b2d3a647dcec743b20854",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "833bce985b5d8c1b15b566a30163cc93",
"text": "1. Fish House plans, which includes typical floor plan, all fixtures etc. 2. Fish House staff record - both technical and non - technical 3. Health record of staff and fish 4. All SOPs relevant to experiments, care, breeding and management of fish 5. Breeding, stock, purchase and sales records 6. Minutes of institutional Animals Ethics Committee Meetings 7. Records of experiments conducted with the number of fish used",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"parent_id": "d168c1cde97b2d3a647dcec743b20854",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "3f4d9082cb76fbcc72b347fca9dd5c7f",
"text": "(copy of Form D)",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"parent_id": "d168c1cde97b2d3a647dcec743b20854",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "de669f26419306ae008a212e3fc393c3",
"text": "8. Mortality, Postmortem Record, wherever required. 9. Clinical record of sick fish. 10. Training record of staff involved in fish activities 11. Water, feed and bedding materials analysis report 12. Health monitoring Records.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"parent_id": "d168c1cde97b2d3a647dcec743b20854",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "2354b6747a8ebf4d13142f862e54c853",
"text": "28. STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES (SOPs) / GUIDELINES",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "665da944f858c23d8a02f239fcbd44fe",
"text": "The Institute should maintain SOPs describing procedures/methods adapted with regard to fish Husbandry, maintenance, breeding, fish facility activities and experimentation.

STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES (SOPs) / GUIDELINES",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "665da944f858c23d8a02f239fcbd44fe",
"text": "The Institute should maintain SOPs describing procedures/methods adapted with regard to fish Husbandry, maintenance, breeding, fish facility activities and experimentation.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"parent_id": "2354b6747a8ebf4d13142f862e54c853",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "16ab22335abaaebf0dcfca54e6c9597a",
"text": "SOP should contain the following items: 1. Name of the Author 2. Title of the SOP 3. Date of approval",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"parent_id": "2354b6747a8ebf4d13142f862e54c853",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "8d6d54236148a65f4305cc2f826b81ae",
"text": "28",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 31,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "ListItem",
"element_id": "3980e411353f711e7271aa37f498adbb",
"text": "4. 5. 6. Objectives 7. Detailed information of the instruments used in relation with fish with methodology (Model no., Serial no., Date of commissioning, etc) The name of the manufacturer of the reagents and the methodology of the analysis pertaining to fish 9. Normal value of all parameters 10. Hazard identification and risk assessment",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "3789ba2cee3640b5dc4e769435f60d22",
"text": "Reference of previous SOP on the same subject and date (Issue no and Date) Location and distribution of SOP’s with the sign of each recipient",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "UncategorizedText",
"element_id": "c85d09f72d3cdafae7d476ea45b407d1",
"text": "8.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "b34c87748944df3b95e2ca7a47e7f00c",
"text": "29. TRANSPORT OF FISH: Before fish are transported from one locality to another, they must undergo health assessment. Appropriate regulatory approval and permits must be in place before any transfer.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "bdaba39cc7a908a31b924b7c40434c33",
"text": "a. The transport of fish from one place to another is very important and must be undertaken with due care. The main considerations for transport of fish are mode of transport, size and type of containers, density in containers, food and water during transit, protection from transit infections, injuries and stress.

TRANSPORT OF FISH: Before fish are transported from one locality to another, they must undergo health assessment. Appropriate regulatory approval and permits must be in place before any transfer.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "bdaba39cc7a908a31b924b7c40434c33",
"text": "a. The transport of fish from one place to another is very important and must be undertaken with due care. The main considerations for transport of fish are mode of transport, size and type of containers, density in containers, food and water during transit, protection from transit infections, injuries and stress.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "40ccc3d39c28a916294cf88bcc77bd20",
"text": "b. The mode of transport of fish depends on the distance, seasonal and climatic conditions and the species of fish. Fish can be transported by road, rail or air taking into consideration of the above factors. In any case the transport stress should be avoided and the containers should be of appropriate size so as to enable the fish to have a comfortable movement and protection from possible injuries. Sometimes injuries can be avoided by reducing space and decreasing the time of transportation. The food and water should be provided in suitable containers or in suitable form to ensure that they get adequate food and more particularly fluid during transit. The transport containers (tanks, tubs, boxes) should be of appropriate size and only a permissible number of fish should be infighting accommodated (Annexure 10).",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "ac5c3263e63cbd29747ec80968f8f66f",
"text": "30. ANIMAL ETHICS",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "d287d68eeadb65cf8a4f31a7a2ad5bbd",
"text": "All scientists working with fish must have a deep ethical consideration for the fish they are dealing with. From the ethical point of view, it is important that such considerations are taken care at the individual level, at institutional level and finally at the national level. Interaction amongst people working in fish house should be organized regularly to discuss ethical issues favoring the wellbeing of fish.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"parent_id": "ac5c3263e63cbd29747ec80968f8f66f",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "PageNumber",
"element_id": "0c6a7c6b01cc541f8862d8f37c9150bb",
"text": "29",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 32,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "0451434c0e433c9474bd83dfebfe397a",
"text": "31. GENETICALLY ENGINEERED / MODIFIED TRANSGENIC FISH",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 33,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "c2a0de1feed14cd4070d51df137ea655",
"text": "Transgenic fish are those fish, into whose germ line the foreign gene(s) have been introduced, whereas knockout fish are those whose specific gene(s) have been disrupted leading to loss of function. These fish can be bred to establish transgenic fish strains.

GENETICALLY ENGINEERED / MODIFIED TRANSGENIC FISH",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 33,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "c2a0de1feed14cd4070d51df137ea655",
"text": "Transgenic fish are those fish, into whose germ line the foreign gene(s) have been introduced, whereas knockout fish are those whose specific gene(s) have been disrupted leading to loss of function. These fish can be bred to establish transgenic fish strains. Transgenic fish are used to study the biological functions of specific genes, to develop fish models for diseases of humans or animals to produce therapeutic products, vaccines and for biological screening, etc. They can be either developed in the laboratory or procured for R&D purpose from registered scientific/academic institutions or commercial firms generally from abroad with approval from appropriate authorities.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 33,
"parent_id": "0451434c0e433c9474bd83dfebfe397a",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "4ac9fa8b2545d16eadc6e51bc24e1f0e",
"text": "For initiating a colony, the breeding stock must be procured from established breeders or suppliers ensuring their genetic makeup and health status of fish is known. In case of an inbred fish line, the characters of the line with their gene distribution and the number of inbred generation must be known for further propagation. The health status should indicate their origin, e.g. conventional, specific pathogen free or transgenic, gnotobiotic or knockout stock.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 33,
"parent_id": "0451434c0e433c9474bd83dfebfe397a",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "f61660362efd7c9da158b7820b3fc127",
"text": "32. MAINTENANCE",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 33,
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "93bb0d29f67e02dfcec8f1e83af3ba02",
"text": "Housing, feeding, ventilation, lighting, sanitation and routine management practices for such fish are similar to those for the other fish species as given in guidelines. However, special care must be taken for transgenic/gene knockout fish where the fish can become susceptible to diseases and special conditions of maintenance are required due to their altered metabolic activities. The transgenic and knockout fish carry additional genes or lack few genes compared to the wild population. To avoid the spread of the genes in to wild population, care should be taken to ensure that they are not inadvertently released in the wild to prevent cross-breeding with other fish.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 33,
"parent_id": "f61660362efd7c9da158b7820b3fc127",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "NarrativeText",
"element_id": "2341364467460aba6a05a24750566ff3",
"text": "The transgenic and knockout fish should be maintained in clean room environment or in fish isolators.",
"metadata": {
"filetype": "application/pdf",
"languages": [
"eng"
"page_number": 33,
"parent_id": "f61660362efd7c9da158b7820b3fc127",
"filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf"
"type": "Title",
"element_id": "68fea36d01d5634a4372da76278ab8b3",
"text": "33.

", "metadata": { "filetype": "application/pdf", "languages": [ "eng" "page_number": 33, "parent_id": "f61660362efd7c9da158b7820b3fc127", "filename": "Guidelines of CPCSEA for Experimentation on Fishes-2021.pdf" "type": "Title", "element_id": "68fea36d01d5634a4372da76278ab8b3", "text": "33.
